meta.title: Math MCQs
meta.description: Practice Algebra, Geometry, and Calculus questions

questions.q: What is 82 + 82?
What is 15 + 15?
What is 4 + 4?
What is 95 + 95?
What is 36 + 36?
What is 32 + 32?
What is 29 + 29?
What is 18 + 18?
What is 14 + 14?
What is 87 + 87?
What is 70 + 70?
What is 12 + 12?
What is 76 + 76?
What is 55 + 55?
What is 5 + 5?
What is 98 + 98?
What is 89 + 89?
What is 28 + 28?
What is 30 + 30?
What is 65 + 65?
What is 78 + 78?
What is 85 + 85?
What is 72 + 72?
What is 26 + 26?
What is 90 + 90?
What is 54 + 54?
What is 94 + 94?
What is 58 + 58?
What is 96 + 96?
What is 1 + 1?
What is 58 + 97?
questions.ex: 58 + 97 = 155. Simple addition.

questions.q: Calculate 144 ÷ 12.
questions.ex: 144 divided by 12 is 12.

questions.q: What is 25 × 7?
questions.ex: 25 multiplied by 7 equals 175.

questions.q: Subtract 67 from 103.
What is the result of (15 + 5) × 3?
questions.ex: First, calculate the sum in the parenthesis: 15 + 5 = 20. Then multiply by 3: 20 × 3 = 60.

questions.q: If you have 24 apples and give away 9, how many do you have left?
questions.ex: 24 - 9 = 15 apples left.

questions.q: A bus travels 60 km in 1 hour. How far does it travel in 3.5 hours?
questions.ex: Distance = Speed × Time. 60 km/h × 3.5 h = 210 km.

questions.q: What is 9 × 8 + 5?
questions.ex: Follow order of operations (PEMDAS/BODMAS): 9 × 8 = 72, then 72 + 5 = 77.

questions.q: Divide 100 by 4 and then add 15.
What is 121 - 34?
Multiply 15 by 6.
What is 72 ÷ 9?
questions.ex: 72 divided by 9 is 8.

questions.q: Calculate (18 - 6) × 5.
Add 3.5 and 2.75.
What is 1000 - 345?
If a dozen eggs cost $3, how much does one egg cost?
questions.ex: A dozen is 12. $3 ÷ 12 = $0.25 per egg.

questions.q: What is 13 × 13?
Subtract 0.75 from 2.

questions.ex: Order of operations: 5 × 5 = 25; 5 ÷ 5 = 1. Then 5 + 25 - 1 = 30 - 1 = 29.

questions.q: If you buy 3 shirts for $15 each, what is the total cost?
questions.ex: 3 shirts × $15/shirt = $45.

questions.q: What is 99 + 101?
Divide 75 by 3.
What is 11 × 12?
Subtract 56 from 200.
If a car travels 300 miles on 10 gallons of gas, what is its miles per gallon (MPG)?
questions.ex: 300 miles ÷ 10 gallons = 30 MPG.

questions.q: What is 4 × 5 × 6?

questions.ex: Align decimal points: 12.300 + 4.560 + 0.123 = 16.983.

questions.q: What is 200 ÷ 8?
Subtract 19 from 5 times 8.
Which of the following is a factor of 48?
questions.ex: A factor divides a number completely. 48 ÷ 6 = 8. So, 6 is a factor of 48.

questions.q: What is the least common multiple (LCM) of 9 and 12?
questions.ex: Multiples of 9: 9, 18, 27, 36, 45... Multiples of 12: 12, 24, 36, 48... The LCM is 36.

questions.q: Which of these numbers is a prime factor of 70?
questions.ex: The prime factors of 70 are 2, 5, and 7. Among the options, 7 is a prime factor.

questions.q: What is the greatest common factor (GCF) of 24 and 36?
Which of the following is a multiple of 11?
questions.ex: A multiple of a number is the result of multiplying that number by an integer. 11 × 3 = 33.

questions.q: List all factors of 18.
questions.ex: The factors of 18 are numbers that divide 18 without a remainder: 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18.

questions.q: What are the first five multiples of 7?
questions.ex: Multiples are found by multiplying the number by 1, 2, 3, ... So, 7×1=7, 7×2=14, 7×3=21, 7×4=28, 7×5=35.

questions.q: Is 51 a prime number or a composite number?
questions.ex: 51 is composite because it has factors other than 1 and itself (e.g., 3 × 17 = 51).

questions.q: Find the GCF of 15, 30, and 45.
Find the LCM of 4, 5, and 6.
Which number is a factor of every number?
questions.ex: 1 is a factor of every number because any number divided by 1 is the number itself.

questions.q: Which of these is NOT a factor of 60?
questions.ex: 60 is not divisible by 8 without a remainder (60 ÷ 8 = 7 with remainder 4).

questions.q: What is the smallest multiple of 15 that is greater than 100?
questions.ex: Multiples of 15: ..., 90, 105, 120... The smallest multiple greater than 100 is 105 (15 × 7).

questions.q: The number 2 is the only even ____ number.
questions.ex: 2 is the only even prime number. All other even numbers are divisible by 2.

questions.q: How many factors does a prime number have?
questions.ex: A prime number has exactly two distinct positive divisors: 1 and itself.

questions.q: Find the prime factorization of 56.
If a number is a multiple of 6, it must also be a multiple of:?
questions.ex: Since 6 = 2 × 3, any multiple of 6 is also a multiple of its factors, 2 and 3.

questions.q: What is the GCF of 17 and 23?
questions.ex: 17 and 23 are both prime numbers. The GCF of two distinct prime numbers is always 1.

questions.q: What is the LCM of 7 and 11?
questions.ex: Since 7 and 11 are prime numbers, their LCM is their product: 7 × 11 = 77.

questions.q: Which of the following is a common factor of 20 and 50?
questions.ex: Factors of 20: 1, 2, 4, 5, 10, 20. Factors of 50: 1, 2, 5, 10, 25, 50. 10 is a common factor.

questions.q: A number that has more than two factors is called a ____ number.
questions.ex: A composite number is a positive integer that has at least one divisor other than 1 and itself.

questions.q: What is the largest factor of any non-zero number?
questions.ex: The largest factor of any non-zero number is the number itself.

questions.q: Find a number that is a multiple of 5 and a factor of 60.
The GCF of two numbers is 6 and their LCM is 72. If one number is 18, what is the other?
questions.ex: For any two positive integers a and b, GCF(a,b) × LCM(a,b) = a × b. So, 6 × 72 = 18 × x. 432 = 18x. x = 432/18 = 24.

questions.q: Which of these is a multiple of 4 but not a multiple of 8?
questions.ex: 20 is 4 × 5 (multiple of 4). 20 is not divisible by 8.

questions.q: What are the common factors of 12 and 16?
questions.ex: Factors of 12: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12. Factors of 16: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16. Common factors are 1, 2, 4.

questions.q: The product of two numbers is 60. Their GCF is 2. What is their LCM?
questions.ex: Product of numbers = GCF × LCM. So, 60 = 2 × LCM. LCM = 60/2 = 30.

questions.q: Which is the smallest prime number?
questions.ex: The smallest prime number is 2. It is the only even prime number.

questions.q: If a number is divisible by 2 and 3, it must be divisible by:?
questions.ex: If a number is divisible by two co-prime numbers, it is divisible by their product. LCM(2,3)=6.

questions.q: How many prime numbers are there between 1 and 20?
questions.ex: Prime numbers between 1 and 20 are: 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19. There are 8 of them.

questions.q: Convert the fraction 3/5 to a decimal.
questions.ex: To convert a fraction to a decimal, divide the numerator by the denominator. 3 ÷ 5 = 0.6.

questions.q: What is 0.25 as a fraction in its simplest form?
questions.ex: 0.25 can be written as 25/100. Simplifying this fraction by dividing both numerator and denominator by 25 gives 1/4.

questions.q: Calculate 1/2 + 1/4.
questions.ex: To add fractions, find a common denominator. 1/2 is equivalent to 2/4. So, 2/4 + 1/4 = 3/4.

questions.q: Convert 0.8 to a fraction.
questions.ex: 0.8 means 8 tenths, which is 8/10. Simplified, this is 4/5.

questions.q: What is 1.5 × 3?
questions.ex: 1.5 multiplied by 3 is 4.5.

questions.q: Simplify the fraction 12/18.
questions.ex: Divide both numerator and denominator by their GCF, which is 6. 12÷6=2, 18÷6=3. So, 2/3.

questions.q: Which decimal is equivalent to 3/8?
Subtract 1/3 from 5/6.
questions.ex: Common denominator is 6. 1/3 = 2/6. So, 5/6 - 2/6 = 3/6, which simplifies to 1/2.

questions.q: What is 2/5 as a decimal?
Multiply 3/4 by 2/3.
Convert 1.75 to an improper fraction.
questions.ex: 1.75 = 1 and 3/4. As an improper fraction, (1×4 + 3)/4 = 7/4. Or 175/100 simplified is 7/4.

questions.q: Divide 1/2 by 1/4.
questions.ex: To divide by a fraction, multiply by its reciprocal: (1/2) × (4/1) = 4/2 = 2.

questions.q: Which is larger: 0.65 or 2/3?
questions.ex: 2/3 is approximately 0.666... which is greater than 0.65.

questions.q: What is 0.05 as a fraction?
questions.ex: 0.05 = 5/100, which simplifies to 1/20.

questions.q: Calculate 2.5 + 0.75 - 1.2.
Express 7/2 as a mixed number.
questions.ex: 7 divided by 2 is 3 with a remainder of 1. So, 7/2 = 3 1/2.

questions.q: What is 0.125 × 8?
Arrange in ascending order: 0.5, 1/3, 0.25.
What is 3 ÷ 0.5?
questions.ex: Dividing by 0.5 is the same as multiplying by 2. So, 3 × 2 = 6.

questions.q: If a pizza is cut into 8 equal slices and you eat 3, what fraction is left?
questions.ex: If 3 slices are eaten out of 8, then 8 - 3 = 5 slices are left. So, 5/8 is left.

questions.q: Convert 2 3/4 to a decimal.
What is 1/5 of 100?
Simplify 0.75 / 0.25.
questions.ex: 0.75 / 0.25 is the same as 75 / 25, which is 3.

questions.q: Which fraction is equivalent to 0.12?
questions.ex: 0.12 = 12/100. Dividing numerator and denominator by 4 gives 3/25.

questions.q: What is 5/8 - 1/4?
questions.ex: Common denominator is 8. 1/4 = 2/8. So, 5/8 - 2/8 = 3/8.

questions.q: Round 3.14159 to two decimal places.
questions.ex: The third decimal place is 1, which is less than 5, so we round down. 3.14.

questions.q: What is 10 × 0.01?
If 1/3 of a number is 12, what is the number?
Convert the decimal 0.007 to a fraction.
questions.ex: 0.007 has three decimal places, so it is 7/1000.

questions.q: What is 25% of 200?
A recipe calls for 2 cups of flour and 1 cup of sugar. What is the ratio of flour to sugar?
questions.ex: The ratio of flour to sugar is 2 cups to 1 cup, which is 2:1.

questions.q: If a $80 item is discounted by 15%, what is the discount amount?
questions.ex: The discount is 15% of $80, which is (15/100) * 80 = $12.

questions.q: The ratio of apples to oranges in a basket is 3:4. If there are 12 apples, how many oranges are there?
questions.ex: Let the ratio be 3x:4x. If 3x = 12, then x = 4. So, oranges = 4x = 4 * 4 = 16.

questions.q: Express 0.6 as a percentage.
questions.ex: To express a decimal as a percentage, multiply by 100. So, 0.6 * 100 = 60%.

questions.q: What percentage of 50 is 10?
Simplify the ratio 18:24.
questions.ex: Divide both parts of the ratio by their GCF, which is 6. 18÷6=3, 24÷6=4. So, 3:4.

questions.q: A store increases the price of a $200 TV by 5%. What is the new price?
If 3 out of 5 students are girls, what percentage of students are girls?
The ratio of the lengths of two ropes is 7:5. If the shorter rope is 25 meters, how long is the longer rope?
questions.ex: Let lengths be 7x and 5x. If 5x = 25m, then x = 5m. Longer rope = 7x = 7*5 = 35m.

questions.q: Convert 125% to a decimal.
questions.ex: To convert a percentage to a decimal, divide by 100. 125/100 = 1.25.

questions.q: A map has a scale of 1:50000. If two towns are 4 cm apart on the map, what is the actual distance?
questions.ex: Actual distance = 4 cm * 50000 = 200000 cm. 200000 cm = 2000 m = 2 km.

questions.q: If you score 45 out of 60 on a test, what is your percentage score?
A mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 5:2. If there are 10 liters of water, how much milk is there?
questions.ex: Let milk be 5x and water be 2x. If 2x = 10L, then x = 5L. Milk = 5x = 5*5 = 25L.

questions.q: What is 0.5% of 400?
If the price of an item decreased from $50 to $40, what is the percentage decrease?
questions.ex: Decrease = $50 - $40 = $10. Percentage decrease = (10/50) * 100% = 20%.

questions.q: The angles of a triangle are in the ratio 1:2:3. What is the measure of the largest angle?
questions.ex: Let angles be x, 2x, 3x. Sum of angles = x + 2x + 3x = 180°. 6x = 180°. x = 30°. Largest angle = 3x = 3*30 = 90°.

questions.q: Convert the fraction 3/20 to a percentage.
A car travels 240 km on 20 liters of petrol. How many km can it travel on 1 liter?
If 60% of a number is 42, what is the number?
questions.ex: Let the number be x. 0.60 * x = 42. So, x = 42 / 0.60 = 70.

questions.q: The ratio of boys to total students in a class is 2:5. If there are 30 students, how many are boys?
What is 150% of 60?
Two numbers are in the ratio 4:5. Their sum is 81. Find the numbers.
questions.ex: Let numbers be 4x and 5x. 4x + 5x = 81. 9x = 81. x = 9. Numbers are 4*9=36 and 5*9=45.

questions.q: A salary of $5000 is increased by 8%. What is the new salary?
Express the ratio 1.5 : 2.5 as a simple whole number ratio.
questions.ex: Multiply both by 10 to get 15:25. Then divide by GCF (5) to get 3:5.

questions.q: If a population of a town increased from 10,000 to 12,000, what is the percentage increase?
A recipe needs 3 parts flour to 2 parts sugar. If you use 9 cups of flour, how much sugar is needed?
questions.ex: Ratio flour:sugar = 3:2. If flour is 3x=9, then x=3. Sugar = 2x = 2*3 = 6 cups.

questions.q: What is 33.33...% as a fraction?
questions.ex: 33.33...% is equivalent to 1/3.

questions.q: If an investment of $1000 earns 5% simple interest per year, how much interest is earned in 3 years?
questions.ex: Interest per year = 5% of $1000 = $50. Interest for 3 years = $50 * 3 = $150.

questions.q: The ratio of width to length of a rectangle is 2:3. If the perimeter is 50 cm, find the length.
questions.ex: Let width=2x, length=3x. Perimeter = 2(2x+3x) = 2(5x) = 10x. 10x = 50cm. x = 5cm. Length = 3x = 15cm.

questions.q: What is the square root of 64?
questions.ex: The square root of 64 is 8, because 8 * 8 = 64.

questions.q: Calculate 2 to the power of 5 (2^5).
What is √121?
questions.ex: The square root of 121 is 11, as 11 * 11 = 121.

questions.q: Simplify 3^2 × 3^3.
questions.ex: When multiplying powers with the same base, add the exponents: 3^(2+3) = 3^5 = 243.

questions.q: What is 7 squared?
questions.ex: 7 squared (7^2) means 7 * 7 = 49.

questions.q: Find the value of 10^0.
questions.ex: Any non-zero number raised to the power of 0 is 1.

questions.q: What is the cube root of 27?
questions.ex: The cube root of 27 is 3, because 3 * 3 * 3 = 27.

questions.q: Simplify (4^3)^2.
questions.ex: When raising a power to another power, multiply the exponents: 4^(3*2) = 4^6 = 4096.

questions.q: What is √25 + √36?
Calculate 5^-2.
questions.ex: A negative exponent means take the reciprocal of the base raised to the positive exponent: 5^-2 = 1/(5^2) = 1/25.

questions.q: What is the square of 1.5?
Simplify 7^5 ÷ 7^3.
questions.ex: When dividing powers with the same base, subtract the exponents: 7^(5-3) = 7^2 = 49.

questions.q: What is the value of (-3)^3?
Find √0.04.
What is (2/3)^2?
If x^2 = 144, what is a possible value of x?
What is 1^100?
questions.ex: 1 raised to any power is 1.

questions.q: Simplify √(16 × 9).
What is 2^3 + 3^2?
The area of a square is 81 cm². What is the length of its side?
questions.ex: Area of square = side^2. So, side = √Area = √81 = 9 cm.

questions.q: What is (1/2)^-3?
Find the value of 4^(3/2).
What is the square root of 2 to the nearest whole number?
questions.ex: √2 is approximately 1.414. The nearest whole number is 1.

questions.q: Simplify (x^5)(x^-2).
What is 0^5?
questions.ex: 0 raised to any positive power is 0.

questions.q: If 10^x = 1000, what is x?
What is the value of (-1)^100?
questions.ex: -1 raised to an even power is 1.

questions.q: Simplify √48.
What is 9^(1/2)?
questions.ex: 9^(1/2) is the same as √9, which is 3.

questions.q: Simplify the expression: 7x - 2x + 5x
questions.ex: Combine like terms: (7 - 2 + 5)x = 10x.

questions.q: Evaluate the expression 3a - 2b if a = 5 and b = 3.
questions.ex: Substitute the values: 3(5) - 2(3) = 15 - 6 = 9.

questions.q: Expand the expression: 4(y - 3).
questions.ex: Distribute the 4 to both terms inside the parenthesis: 4*y - 4*3 = 4y - 12.

questions.q: What is the coefficient of x in the expression 5y - x + 9?
questions.ex: The term with x is -x, which can be written as -1x. So the coefficient is -1.

questions.q: Factorize the expression: 6p + 9q.
questions.ex: The greatest common factor of 6p and 9q is 3. So, 6p + 9q = 3(2p) + 3(3q) = 3(2p + 3q).

questions.q: Simplify: 2(x + 3) + 3(x - 1)
What is the value of x^2 - 2x + 1 when x = 3?
Identify the like terms in: 3a + 2b - a + 4b
questions.ex: Like terms have the same variable raised to the same power. So, 3a and -a are like terms, and 2b and 4b are like terms.

questions.q: Subtract (2x + y) from (5x + 3y).
What is the degree of the polynomial 4x^3 - 2x^2 + 5x - 1?
questions.ex: The degree of a polynomial is the highest power of the variable. Here it is 3.

questions.q: Simplify: (a + b)(a - b)
questions.ex: This is a difference of squares: (a+b)(a-b) = a^2 - ab + ba - b^2 = a^2 - b^2.

questions.q: If p = -2, what is the value of p^3 + 3p^2?
Expand (x + 5)^2.
Factorize x^2 - 9.
questions.ex: This is a difference of squares: x^2 - 3^2 = (x-3)(x+3).

questions.q: The sum of two numbers is 15 and their product is 50. If the numbers are x and y, which expression represents their product?
questions.ex: The product of x and y is represented by xy.

questions.q: Simplify: (12a^3 b^2) / (4a^2 b)
What is the constant term in the expression 2x^2 - 7x + 4?
questions.ex: The constant term is the term without a variable, which is 4.

questions.q: If the length of a rectangle is (x+3) and width is (x-2), what is its area?
questions.ex: Area = length × width = (x+3)(x-2) = x^2 - 2x + 3x - 6 = x^2 + x - 6.

questions.q: Combine like terms: 5xy + 2x - 3xy + 4x
Factorize completely: 2x^2 - 8
questions.ex: First take out common factor 2: 2(x^2-4). Then factor difference of squares: 2(x-2)(x+2).

questions.q: What is the perimeter of a square with side length (s+1)?
questions.ex: Perimeter of a square = 4 × side length = 4(s+1) = 4s + 4.

questions.q: Simplify: - (3x - 2y) + (x + y)
Evaluate a(b+c) when a=2, b=3, c=-1.
The expression for '5 less than twice a number x' is:
questions.ex: Twice a number x is 2x. 5 less than that is 2x - 5.

questions.q: Factorize y^2 + 7y + 12.
questions.ex: We need two numbers that multiply to 12 and add to 7. These are 3 and 4. So, (y+3)(y+4).

questions.q: What is the term for an algebraic expression with only one term?
questions.ex: A monomial is an algebraic expression consisting of one term.

questions.q: Simplify (3x^2y)^3.
If an item costs 'c' dollars and sales tax is 8%, what is the expression for the total cost?
questions.ex: Sales tax amount is 0.08c. Total cost is original cost plus tax: c + 0.08c or 1.08c.

questions.q: The product of a number and 3, increased by 5, is written as:
questions.ex: Let the number be n. Product of n and 3 is 3n. Increased by 5 is 3n + 5.

questions.q: Simplify (x+y) - (x-y).
Solve for x: x + 5 = 12
Solve for y: 3y = 21
Solve for a: a - 7 = -2
Solve for b: b/4 = 6
Solve for x: 2x + 3 = 11
If 5x - 2 = 18, what is x?
Solve for z: z/3 + 1 = 5
What is the value of p if 4(p - 2) = 16?
Solve for m: 7 - m = 10
If (x+1)/2 = 3, find x.
Solve for y: 2(y + 4) = 3(y - 1)
The sum of a number and 8 is 20. What is the number?
questions.ex: Let the number be x. x + 8 = 20 => x = 20 - 8 => x = 12.

questions.q: Solve for k: 0.5k = 4
If 3x + 2x = 25, what is x?
Solve for x: x/2 = x/3 + 1
questions.ex: Multiply by 6 (LCM of 2,3): 3x = 2x + 6 => 3x - 2x = 6 => x = 6.

questions.q: Twice a number decreased by 5 is 13. Find the number.
questions.ex: Let the number be n. 2n - 5 = 13 => 2n = 18 => n = 9.

questions.q: Solve for a: 5a - 9 = 2a + 6
What value of y makes 10 - 2y = 4 true?
If a number is divided by 4 and then 3 is subtracted, the result is 2. What is the number?
questions.ex: Let number be x. x/4 - 3 = 2 => x/4 = 5 => x = 20.

questions.q: Solve for x: -3x + 7 = -5
The perimeter of a rectangle is 30 cm. If its length is 8 cm, what is its width (w)? (Equation: 2(8+w)=30)
Solve for b: (2b + 5)/3 = 7
Three consecutive integers sum to 33. If the smallest is x, the equation is x + (x+1) + (x+2) = 33. What is x?
Solve for x: 1.5x + 2 = 8
If 8 more than twice a number is 22, what is the number?
questions.ex: Let number be n. 2n + 8 = 22 => 2n = 14 => n = 7.

questions.q: Solve for y: 4y = y + 15
What is the solution to x - 0.2x = 16?
Solve for p: p + p/2 = 9
A father is 3 times as old as his son. If the sum of their ages is 48, how old is the son (s)? (Equation: s + 3s = 48)
Solve for x: 5(x - 1) = 3(x + 1)
What is the sum of angles in a triangle?
questions.ex: The sum of the interior angles of a triangle is always 180 degrees.

questions.q: A rectangle has a length of 10 cm and a width of 5 cm. What is its area?
questions.ex: Area of a rectangle = length × width = 10 cm × 5 cm = 50 sq cm.

questions.q: What is the perimeter of a square with a side length of 7 units?
questions.ex: Perimeter of a square = 4 × side length = 4 × 7 = 28 units.

questions.q: The radius of a circle is 4 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π ≈ 3.14)
questions.ex: Circumference of a circle = 2 × π × radius = 2 × 3.14 × 4 cm = 25.12 cm.

questions.q: Which of the following is a property of a parallelogram?
questions.ex: A key property of a parallelogram is that its opposite sides are parallel.

questions.q: What is the volume of a cube with an edge length of 3 cm?
questions.ex: Volume of a cube = edge × edge × edge = 3 cm × 3 cm × 3 cm = 27 cubic cm.

questions.q: An isosceles triangle has two sides of equal length. If one of the equal sides is 5 cm and the base is 6 cm, what is its perimeter?
questions.ex: Perimeter = 5 cm + 5 cm + 6 cm = 16 cm.

questions.q: What is the formula for the area of a triangle?
questions.ex: The area of a triangle is calculated as 0.5 × base × height.

questions.q: How many faces does a cuboid have?
questions.ex: A cuboid has 6 faces.

questions.q: If two lines are perpendicular, what is the angle between them?
questions.ex: Perpendicular lines intersect at a 90-degree angle.

questions.q: What is the name of a polygon with 5 sides?
questions.ex: A polygon with 5 sides is called a pentagon.

questions.q: The diameter of a circle is 10 cm. What is its radius?
questions.ex: Radius = Diameter / 2 = 10 cm / 2 = 5 cm.

questions.q: Which of these shapes has all sides equal and all angles equal to 90 degrees?
questions.ex: A square has all sides equal and all angles equal to 90 degrees.

questions.q: What is the area of a circle with radius 'r'?
questions.ex: The area of a circle is given by the formula A = πr².

questions.q: A triangle has angles 30°, 60°, and 90°. What type of triangle is it?
questions.ex: A triangle with a 90° angle is a right-angled triangle. Since all angles are different, it's also scalene.

questions.q: How many vertices does a triangular prism have?
questions.ex: A triangular prism has 6 vertices (3 on each triangular base).

questions.q: What is the sum of the exterior angles of any convex polygon?
questions.ex: The sum of the exterior angles of any convex polygon is always 360 degrees.

questions.q: A cylinder has a radius of 3 cm and a height of 10 cm. What is its volume? (Use π ≈ 3.14)
questions.ex: Volume of a cylinder = π × radius² × height = 3.14 × (3 cm)² × 10 cm = 282.6 cubic cm.

questions.q: What is the longest chord in a circle called?
questions.ex: The diameter is the longest chord in a circle, passing through the center.

questions.q: If the area of a square is 64 sq units, what is the length of its side?
questions.ex: Side = √Area = √64 = 8 units.

questions.q: How many edges does a cube have?
questions.ex: A cube has 12 edges.

questions.q: A regular hexagon has how many lines of symmetry?
questions.ex: A regular hexagon has 6 lines of symmetry.

questions.q: What is the point of intersection of the medians of a triangle called?
questions.ex: The point of intersection of the medians of a triangle is called the centroid.

questions.q: The measure of an angle is 75 degrees. What is the measure of its complementary angle?
questions.ex: Complementary angles add up to 90 degrees. So, 90 - 75 = 15 degrees.

questions.q: What is the shape of the base of a cone?
questions.ex: The base of a cone is a circle.

questions.q: Two angles are supplementary. If one angle is 120 degrees, what is the other angle?
questions.ex: Supplementary angles add up to 180 degrees. So, 180 - 120 = 60 degrees.

questions.q: What is the formula for the surface area of a sphere with radius 'r'?
questions.ex: The surface area of a sphere is given by the formula A = 4πr².

questions.q: A rhombus has diagonals of length 6 cm and 8 cm. What is its area?
questions.ex: Area of a rhombus = 0.5 × d1 × d2 = 0.5 × 6 cm × 8 cm = 24 sq cm.

questions.q: How many diagonals does a pentagon have?
questions.ex: A pentagon has 5 diagonals. The formula is n(n-3)/2, where n is the number of sides.

questions.q: What is the name for a triangle with all three sides of different lengths?
questions.ex: A triangle with all three sides of different lengths is called a scalene triangle.

questions.q: What is sin(30°)?
What is cos(60°)?
What is tan(45°)?
If sin(θ) = 3/5, what is cos(θ) if θ is an acute angle?
questions.ex: Using sin²(θ) + cos²(θ) = 1, (3/5)² + cos²(θ) = 1 => 9/25 + cos²(θ) = 1 => cos²(θ) = 16/25 => cos(θ) = 4/5 (since θ is acute).

questions.q: What is the value of sin²(θ) + cos²(θ)?
questions.ex: This is a fundamental trigonometric identity: sin²(θ) + cos²(θ) = 1.

questions.q: What is sec(θ) in terms of cos(θ)?
questions.ex: sec(θ) is the reciprocal of cos(θ), so sec(θ) = 1/cos(θ).

questions.q: What is cot(θ) in terms of tan(θ)?
questions.ex: cot(θ) is the reciprocal of tan(θ), so cot(θ) = 1/tan(θ).

questions.q: In a right-angled triangle, the side opposite the right angle is called the?
questions.ex: The side opposite the right angle in a right-angled triangle is called the hypotenuse.

questions.q: What is sin(90°)?
What is cos(0°)?
If tan(θ) = 1, what is θ (for 0° ≤ θ < 90°)?
What is the range of values for sin(θ)?
questions.ex: The values of sin(θ) range from -1 to 1, inclusive.

questions.q: What is the range of values for cos(θ)?
questions.ex: The values of cos(θ) range from -1 to 1, inclusive.

questions.q: What is tan(θ) equal to?
questions.ex: tan(θ) = sin(θ)/cos(θ).

questions.q: What is cosec(θ) in terms of sin(θ)?
questions.ex: cosec(θ) is the reciprocal of sin(θ), so cosec(θ) = 1/sin(θ).

questions.q: What is sin(0°)?
What is cos(90°)?
The angle of elevation of a ladder leaning against a wall is 60° and the foot of the ladder is 4.6 m away from the wall. What is the length of the ladder?
questions.ex: cos(60°) = adjacent/hypotenuse = 4.6/L. Since cos(60°) = 0.5, 0.5 = 4.6/L => L = 4.6/0.5 = 9.2 m.

questions.q: What is tan(0°)?
What is tan(90°)?
questions.ex: tan(90°) = sin(90°)/cos(90°) = 1/0, which is undefined.

questions.q: If cos(θ) = 12/13, what is sin(θ) if θ is an acute angle?
What is the value of 2sin(30°)cos(30°)?
questions.ex: This is the double angle formula for sine: sin(2θ) = 2sin(θ)cos(θ). So, 2sin(30°)cos(30°) = sin(2×30°) = sin(60°). sin(60°) = √3/2.

questions.q: What is sin(A + B)?
questions.ex: The sum formula for sine is sin(A + B) = sinAcosB + cosAsinB.

questions.q: What is cos(A - B)?
questions.ex: The difference formula for cosine is cos(A - B) = cosAcosB + sinAsinB.

questions.q: Convert 180 degrees to radians.
questions.ex: To convert degrees to radians, multiply by π/180. So, 180 × (π/180) = π radians.

questions.q: Convert π/3 radians to degrees.
questions.ex: To convert radians to degrees, multiply by 180/π. So, (π/3) × (180/π) = 60°.

questions.q: What is the period of the function y = sin(x)?
questions.ex: The period of y = sin(x) is 2π, meaning the function repeats every 2π interval.

questions.q: What is the period of the function y = tan(x)?
questions.ex: The period of y = tan(x) is π, meaning the function repeats every π interval.

questions.q: If a right triangle has legs of length 3 and 4, what is the length of the hypotenuse?
questions.ex: By Pythagorean theorem, a² + b² = c². So, 3² + 4² = c² => 9 + 16 = c² => 25 = c² => c = 5.

questions.q: What is the value of sec²(θ) - tan²(θ)?
questions.ex: This is a Pythagorean identity: 1 + tan²(θ) = sec²(θ), so sec²(θ) - tan²(θ) = 1.

questions.q: What are the coordinates of the origin in a Cartesian coordinate system?
questions.ex: The origin is the point where the x-axis and y-axis intersect, which is at (0, 0).

questions.q: A point is in the second quadrant. What are the signs of its coordinates?
questions.ex: In the second quadrant, the x-coordinate is negative and the y-coordinate is positive.

questions.q: What is the distance between the points (1, 2) and (4, 6)?
What is the slope of the line passing through the points (2, 3) and (4, 7)?
What is the equation of a line with slope 3 and y-intercept 2?
questions.ex: The slope-intercept form is y = mx + c, where m is the slope and c is the y-intercept. So, y = 3x + 2.

questions.q: What is the midpoint of the line segment connecting (0, 0) and (6, 8)?
What is the slope of a horizontal line?
questions.ex: A horizontal line has a slope of 0 because the y-coordinate does not change.

questions.q: What is the slope of a vertical line?
questions.ex: A vertical line has an undefined slope because the x-coordinate does not change, leading to division by zero in the slope formula.

questions.q: The point (a, b) lies on the x-axis. What is the value of b?
questions.ex: Any point on the x-axis has a y-coordinate of 0.

questions.q: The point (a, b) lies on the y-axis. What is the value of a?
questions.ex: Any point on the y-axis has an x-coordinate of 0.

questions.q: What is the equation of the x-axis?
questions.ex: The equation of the x-axis is y = 0, as all points on it have a y-coordinate of 0.

questions.q: What is the equation of the y-axis?
questions.ex: The equation of the y-axis is x = 0, as all points on it have an x-coordinate of 0.

questions.q: Two lines are parallel. What is true about their slopes?
options: The product of their slopes is -1.
One slope is 0 and the other is undefined.
questions.ex: Parallel lines have equal slopes.

questions.q: Two lines are perpendicular (and neither is vertical). What is true about their slopes m₁ and m₂?
questions.ex: For perpendicular lines, the product of their slopes is -1 (i.e., they are negative reciprocals).

questions.q: What is the distance of the point (3, 4) from the origin?
questions.ex: Distance from origin = √(x² + y²). So, √(3² + 4²) = √(9 + 16) = √25 = 5.

questions.q: The line y = 2x + 5 intersects the y-axis at what point?
questions.ex: The y-intercept is the point where x=0. So, y = 2(0) + 5 = 5. The point is (0, 5).

questions.q: The line y = -x + 3 intersects the x-axis at what point?
questions.ex: The x-intercept is the point where y=0. So, 0 = -x + 3 => x = 3. The point is (3, 0).

questions.q: What is the slope of the line 2x + 3y = 6?
questions.ex: Rewrite in slope-intercept form (y = mx + c): 3y = -2x + 6 => y = (-2/3)x + 2. The slope is -2/3.

questions.q: A point (-2, -5) is in which quadrant?
questions.ex: In the third quadrant, both x and y coordinates are negative.

questions.q: What is the equation of a circle with center (0,0) and radius r?
questions.ex: The standard equation of a circle centered at the origin is x² + y² = r².

questions.q: What is the radius of the circle x² + y² = 16?
questions.ex: Comparing with x² + y² = r², we have r² = 16, so r = √16 = 4.

questions.q: The points (1,1), (1,5), and (4,1) are vertices of what type of triangle?
questions.ex: The side between (1,1) and (1,5) is vertical. The side between (1,1) and (4,1) is horizontal. Thus, these two sides are perpendicular, forming a right angle.

questions.q: What is the area of a triangle with vertices (0,0), (4,0), and (0,3)?
questions.ex: This is a right-angled triangle with base 4 and height 3. Area = 0.5 × base × height = 0.5 × 4 × 3 = 6 sq units.

questions.q: The line segment joining A(x₁, y₁) and B(x₂, y₂) is divided by a point P(x, y) in the ratio m:n. What is the formula for x?
questions.ex: This is the section formula for the x-coordinate: x = (mx₂ + nx₁)/(m + n).

questions.q: What is the slope of the line perpendicular to y = 3x - 1?
questions.ex: The slope of the given line is 3. The slope of a perpendicular line is the negative reciprocal, which is -1/3.

questions.q: Which of these points lies on the line y = x + 2?
questions.ex: Substitute the coordinates into the equation. For (0,2): 2 = 0 + 2, which is true.

questions.q: What is the y-intercept of the line 4x - 2y = 8?
questions.ex: To find the y-intercept, set x = 0: 4(0) - 2y = 8 => -2y = 8 => y = -4.

questions.q: The distance between (0,y) and (0,5) is 3 units. What is a possible value of y?
questions.ex: Distance = |y - 5|. So, |y - 5| = 3. This means y - 5 = 3 or y - 5 = -3. So y = 8 or y = 2. A possible value is 2.

questions.q: What is the equation of a line passing through (1,1) with slope 1?
questions.ex: Using point-slope form y - y₁ = m(x - x₁): y - 1 = 1(x - 1) => y - 1 = x - 1 => y = x.

questions.q: A line passes through (2,5) and is parallel to the x-axis. What is its equation?
questions.ex: A line parallel to the x-axis is horizontal and has the form y = constant. Since it passes through (2,5), the constant is 5. So, y = 5.

questions.q: What is the mean of the numbers 2, 4, 6, 8, 10?
questions.ex: Mean = (Sum of numbers) / (Count of numbers) = (2+4+6+8+10)/5 = 30/5 = 6.

questions.q: What is the median of the numbers 1, 3, 3, 6, 7, 8, 9?
questions.ex: The numbers are already sorted. The median is the middle value, which is 6.

questions.q: What is the mode of the numbers 2, 2, 3, 4, 4, 4, 5?
questions.ex: The mode is the number that appears most frequently, which is 4.

questions.q: What is the range of the data set: 10, 15, 9, 25, 12?
questions.ex: Range = Maximum value - Minimum value = 25 - 9 = 16.

questions.q: A coin is tossed. What is the probability of getting a head?
questions.ex: There are 2 possible outcomes (Head, Tail), and 1 favorable outcome (Head). P(Head) = 1/2 = 0.5.

questions.q: A standard die is rolled. What is the probability of rolling a 3?
questions.ex: There are 6 possible outcomes (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6), and 1 favorable outcome (3). P(3) = 1/6.

questions.q: If P(A) = 0.4, what is P(not A)?
A bag contains 3 red balls and 2 blue balls. What is the probability of picking a red ball?
questions.ex: Total balls = 3 + 2 = 5. Number of red balls = 3. P(Red) = 3/5.

questions.q: What is the probability of an event that is certain to happen?
questions.ex: The probability of a certain event is 1.

questions.q: What is the probability of an impossible event?
questions.ex: The probability of an impossible event is 0.

questions.q: The median of 10, 20, 30, x, 50 is 35. What is x, assuming numbers are in order?
questions.ex: Since there are 5 numbers, the median is the 3rd number, which is 30. If the median is 35, then x must be 35 if the numbers are 10, 20, x, 30, 50 or 10, 20, 30, x, 50. If the median is the middle value of the ordered set, and the set is 10, 20, 30, x, 50, the median is 30. If the set is 10, 20, x, 30, 50 and median is 35, then x must be 35.

questions.q: What is the sum of probabilities of all possible outcomes of an experiment?
questions.ex: The sum of probabilities of all elementary events of an experiment is 1.

questions.q: A card is drawn from a standard deck of 52 cards. What is the probability of drawing an Ace?
questions.ex: There are 4 Aces in a deck of 52 cards. P(Ace) = 4/52 = 1/13.

questions.q: Two coins are tossed. What is the probability of getting two heads?
questions.ex: Possible outcomes: HH, HT, TH, TT (4 outcomes). Favorable outcome: HH (1 outcome). P(HH) = 1/4.

questions.q: The mean of 5 numbers is 10. If four of the numbers are 7, 8, 12, 13, what is the fifth number?
questions.ex: Sum of 5 numbers = Mean × 5 = 10 × 5 = 50. Sum of four numbers = 7+8+12+13 = 40. Fifth number = 50 - 40 = 10.

questions.q: A die is rolled. What is the probability of getting an even number?
questions.ex: Even numbers are 2, 4, 6 (3 favorable outcomes). Total outcomes = 6. P(Even) = 3/6 = 1/2.

questions.q: Which measure of central tendency is most affected by extreme values?
questions.ex: The mean is most affected by outliers or extreme values because it uses all values in its calculation.

questions.q: If events A and B are mutually exclusive, what is P(A and B)?
questions.ex: Mutually exclusive events cannot occur at the same time, so the probability of both occurring is 0.

questions.q: What is the median of the data: 5, 2, 8, 2, 9, 4?
questions.ex: First, sort the data: 2, 2, 4, 5, 8, 9. Since there are 6 numbers (even), the median is the average of the two middle numbers: (4+5)/2 = 4.5.

questions.q: A spinner has 4 equal sectors colored red, blue, green, and yellow. What is the probability of landing on blue?
questions.ex: There are 4 equally likely outcomes. P(Blue) = 1/4.

questions.q: The probability of rain tomorrow is 0.7. What is the probability that it will not rain?
questions.ex: P(not rain) = 1 - P(rain) = 1 - 0.7 = 0.3.

questions.q: In a class of 30 students, 18 are girls. What is the probability that a randomly selected student is a boy?
questions.ex: Number of boys = 30 - 18 = 12. P(Boy) = 12/30 = 2/5.

questions.q: What does 'P(A|B)' represent?
options: Probability of A given B has occurred
Probability of B given A has occurred
questions.ex: P(A|B) represents the conditional probability of event A occurring, given that event B has already occurred.

questions.q: If two events A and B are independent, then P(A and B) = ?
questions.ex: For independent events, the probability of both occurring is the product of their individual probabilities: P(A and B) = P(A) × P(B).

questions.q: The mode of a dataset is the value that:
options: Is the difference between max and min
questions.ex: The mode is the value that appears most often in a dataset.

questions.q: A survey of 100 people found 60 like coffee and 40 like tea. 20 like both. How many like only coffee?
questions.ex: Number who like only coffee = (Number who like coffee) - (Number who like both) = 60 - 20 = 40.

questions.q: What is the range of probabilities for any event?
questions.ex: The probability of any event P(E) must satisfy 0 ≤ P(E) ≤ 1.

questions.q: A fair six-sided die is rolled twice. What is the probability of rolling a 6 on the first roll and a 6 on the second roll?
questions.ex: The rolls are independent. P(6 on first) = 1/6. P(6 on second) = 1/6. P(6 and 6) = (1/6) × (1/6) = 1/36.

questions.q: The average score of 20 students is 75. If a student scoring 95 is added, what is the new average?
questions.ex: Original total score = 20 × 75 = 1500. New total score = 1500 + 95 = 1595. New number of students = 21. New average = 1595 / 21 ≈ 75.95, which is closest to 76.

questions.q: From a group of 5 men and 3 women, one person is selected at random. What is the probability that the selected person is a woman?
questions.ex: Total people = 5 + 3 = 8. Number of women = 3. P(Woman) = 3/8.

questions.q: If P is 'It is raining' and Q is 'The ground is wet', what does P → Q represent?
options: It is raining and the ground is wet.
It is raining or the ground is wet.
If it is raining, then the ground is wet.
questions.ex: P → Q represents a conditional statement: 'If P, then Q'.

questions.q: What is the negation of the statement 'All cats are black'?
questions.ex: The negation of 'All A are B' is 'Some A are not B'.

questions.q: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {3, 4, 5}. What is A ∪ B (A union B)?
questions.ex: The union of two sets contains all elements that are in A, or in B, or in both.

questions.q: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {3, 4, 5}. What is A ∩ B (A intersection B)?
questions.ex: The intersection of two sets contains all elements that are common to both A and B.

questions.q: What is the empty set, denoted by {} or ∅?
options: A set with one element, zero.
A set containing all possible elements.
A set with an infinite number of elements.
questions.ex: The empty set is a set that has no elements.

questions.q: If a statement is 'P and Q' (P ∧ Q), when is this statement true?
options: When both P and Q are true.
When either P or Q is true.
questions.ex: The conjunction 'P and Q' is true if and only if both P and Q are true.

questions.q: If a statement is 'P or Q' (P ∨ Q), when is this statement false?
options: When both P and Q are false.
When P is true and Q is false.
questions.ex: The disjunction 'P or Q' is false if and only if both P and Q are false.

questions.q: What is the contrapositive of the statement 'If P, then Q' (P → Q)?
options: If not P, then not Q.
If not Q, then not P.
questions.ex: The contrapositive of P → Q is (not Q) → (not P).

questions.q: Let U = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} be the universal set and A = {1, 3}. What is A' (the complement of A)?
questions.ex: The complement of A contains all elements in U that are not in A.

questions.q: How many subsets does a set with 3 elements have?
questions.ex: A set with n elements has 2ⁿ subsets. So, for n=3, there are 2³ = 8 subsets.

questions.q: Which of the following is an example of a tautology?
questions.ex: A tautology is a statement that is always true. P ∨ (¬P) (P or not P) is always true.

questions.q: Which of the following is an example of a contradiction?
questions.ex: A contradiction is a statement that is always false. P ∧ (¬P) (P and not P) is always false.

questions.q: What does A ⊆ B mean?
options: A is a proper subset of B.
A is a superset of B.
A is a subset of B (A could be equal to B).
A and B are disjoint sets.
questions.ex: A ⊆ B means that A is a subset of B, which includes the possibility that A = B.

questions.q: If A = {a, b} and B = {1, 2}, what is the Cartesian product A × B?
questions.ex: The Cartesian product A × B is the set of all ordered pairs (x, y) where x ∈ A and y ∈ B.

questions.q: What is De Morgan's Law for sets?
questions.ex: One of De Morgan's Laws states that (A ∪ B)' = A' ∩ B'. The other is (A ∩ B)' = A' ∪ B'.

questions.q: A statement 'P if and only if Q' (P ↔ Q) is true when?
options: P and Q have the same truth value.
P is true and Q is false.
P is false and Q is true.
P and Q are both false.
questions.ex: The biconditional P ↔ Q is true if P and Q are both true, or if P and Q are both false.

questions.q: What is the power set of A = {x, y}?
questions.ex: The power set of A is the set of all subsets of A, including the empty set and A itself.

questions.q: The statement 'If it is sunny, I will go to the beach.' What is the converse?
options: If I go to the beach, then it is sunny.
If it is not sunny, I will not go to the beach.
If I do not go to the beach, then it is not sunny.
It is sunny and I go to the beach.
questions.ex: The converse of 'If P, then Q' is 'If Q, then P'.

questions.q: The statement 'If it is sunny, I will go to the beach.' What is the inverse?
options: If I go to the beach, then it is sunny.
If it is not sunny, I will not go to the beach.
If I do not go to the beach, then it is not sunny.
It is not sunny or I go to the beach.
questions.ex: The inverse of 'If P, then Q' is 'If not P, then not Q'.

questions.q: Let A = {multiples of 3 less than 10} and B = {even numbers less than 10}. What is A - B (A difference B)?
questions.ex: A = {3, 6, 9}. B = {2, 4, 6, 8}. A - B contains elements in A but not in B. So, A - B = {3, 9}.

questions.q: Which symbol represents 'for all' or 'for every'?
questions.ex: The universal quantifier ∀ means 'for all' or 'for every'.

questions.q: Which symbol represents 'there exists'?
questions.ex: The existential quantifier ∃ means 'there exists'.

questions.q: If n(A) = 5 and n(B) = 3, and n(A ∩ B) = 2, what is n(A ∪ B)?
questions.ex: Using the formula n(A ∪ B) = n(A) + n(B) - n(A ∩ B) = 5 + 3 - 2 = 6.

questions.q: A set S is a proper subset of T (S ⊂ T) if:
questions.ex: S is a proper subset of T if all elements of S are in T, but S is not equal to T (T has at least one element not in S).

questions.q: What is the truth value of 'If 2+2=5, then the sky is green'?
questions.ex: A conditional statement P → Q is false only when P is true and Q is false. Here, P ('2+2=5') is false, so the entire statement is true, regardless of Q's truth value.

questions.q: Two sets A and B are disjoint if:
questions.ex: Two sets are disjoint if their intersection is the empty set, meaning they have no elements in common.

questions.q: The argument form 'If P then Q. P. Therefore Q.' is called:
questions.ex: This is Modus Ponens, a valid form of deductive argument.

questions.q: The argument form 'If P then Q. Not Q. Therefore not P.' is called:
questions.ex: This is Modus Tollens, a valid form of deductive argument.

questions.q: What is the cardinality of the set A = {letters in the word 'APPLE'}?
questions.ex: The distinct letters in 'APPLE' are A, P, L, E. So the cardinality is 4.

questions.q: If A is the set of prime numbers and B is the set of even numbers, what is A ∩ B?
questions.ex: The only even prime number is 2. So, A ∩ B = {2}.

questions.q: What is the derivative of f(x) = x²?
questions.ex: Using the power rule, d/dx (xⁿ) = nxⁿ⁻¹, so d/dx (x²) = 2x²⁻¹ = 2x.

questions.q: What is the derivative of a constant function, f(x) = c?
questions.ex: The derivative of a constant is always 0, as the rate of change is zero.

questions.q: What does the first derivative of a function represent geometrically?
options: The slope of the tangent line to the curve at a point.
questions.ex: The first derivative f'(x) gives the slope of the tangent line to the graph of f(x) at any point x.

questions.q: What is the integral of f(x) = 2x dx?
questions.ex: Using the power rule for integration, ∫xⁿ dx = (xⁿ⁺¹)/(n+1) + C. So, ∫2x dx = 2(x²/2) + C = x² + C.

questions.q: What is the limit of f(x) = x + 2 as x approaches 3?
What is the derivative of f(x) = sin(x)?
questions.ex: The derivative of sin(x) is cos(x).

questions.q: What is the derivative of f(x) = eˣ?
questions.ex: The exponential function eˣ is its own derivative.

questions.q: If f'(x) > 0 on an interval, what can be said about f(x) on that interval?
questions.ex: If the first derivative is positive, the function is increasing.

questions.q: What is the integral of f(x) = 1 dx?
questions.ex: The integral of 1 with respect to x is x + C.

questions.q: What is the chain rule for derivatives if y = f(g(x))?
questions.ex: The chain rule states that dy/dx = dy/du × du/dx, or y' = f'(g(x))g'(x).

questions.q: What is the derivative of f(x) = cos(x)?
questions.ex: The derivative of cos(x) is -sin(x).

questions.q: What is the definite integral ∫₀¹ x dx?
What is the derivative of f(x) = ln(x)?
questions.ex: The derivative of ln(x) is 1/x for x > 0.

questions.q: If f''(x) > 0 on an interval, what can be said about the concavity of f(x)?
questions.ex: If the second derivative is positive, the function is concave up (holds water).

questions.q: What is the product rule for derivatives if y = u(x)v(x)?
questions.ex: The product rule is (uv)' = u'v + uv'.

questions.q: What is the integral of f(x) = eˣ dx?
questions.ex: The integral of eˣ is eˣ + C.

questions.q: A critical point of a function f(x) occurs where f'(x) is:?
questions.ex: Critical points are points where the first derivative is zero or undefined.

questions.q: What is the derivative of f(x) = 5x³ - 2x + 7?
The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus links which two concepts?
questions.ex: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus establishes the relationship between differentiation and integration.

questions.q: What is the limit of f(x) = (sin x)/x as x approaches 0?
questions.ex: This is a standard limit in calculus: lim (x→0) (sin x)/x = 1.

questions.q: What is the integral of f(x) = cos(x) dx?
questions.ex: The integral of cos(x) is sin(x) + C.

questions.q: If a function has a local maximum at x=c, what is true about f'(c) (assuming f is differentiable)?
questions.ex: At a local maximum or minimum of a differentiable function, the first derivative is zero (Fermat's Theorem).

questions.q: What is the derivative of f(x) = tan(x)?
questions.ex: The derivative of tan(x) is sec²(x).

questions.q: The area under the curve of y = f(x) from x=a to x=b is given by:?
questions.ex: The definite integral ∫ₐᵇ f(x) dx represents the area under the curve of f(x) from a to b.

questions.q: What is the derivative of f(x) = xⁿ using the power rule?
questions.ex: The power rule states that d/dx (xⁿ) = nxⁿ⁻¹.

questions.q: What is the limit of f(x) = 1/x as x approaches ∞?
questions.ex: As x becomes very large, 1/x becomes very small, approaching 0.

questions.q: What is the quotient rule for derivatives if y = u(x)/v(x)?
questions.ex: The quotient rule is (u/v)' = (u'v - uv') / v².

questions.q: An inflection point occurs where the _______ changes.
questions.ex: An inflection point is a point on a curve at which the concavity changes (from concave up to concave down, or vice versa). This often occurs where f''(x) = 0 or is undefined.

questions.q: What is the integral of f(x) = 1/x dx?
questions.ex: The integral of 1/x is ln|x| + C.

questions.q: If f(x) is continuous on [a,b] and differentiable on (a,b), and f(a)=f(b), then there exists some c in (a,b) such that f'(c)=0. This is known as:?
questions.ex: This is the statement of Rolle's Theorem, a special case of the Mean Value Theorem.

questions.q: A train travels at 60 km/h for 2 hours and then at 80 km/h for 1 hour. What is the average speed of the train for the entire journey?
questions.ex: Distance1 = 60*2 = 120 km. Distance2 = 80*1 = 80 km. Total distance = 120+80 = 200 km. Total time = 2+1 = 3 hours. Average speed = Total distance / Total time = 200/3 = 66.67 km/h.

questions.q: If 5 apples cost $2.50, how much do 12 apples cost?
questions.ex: Cost per apple = $2.50 / 5 = $0.50. Cost of 12 apples = 12 * $0.50 = $6.00.

questions.q: A recipe calls for 2 cups of flour to make 24 cookies. How many cups of flour are needed to make 36 cookies?
questions.ex: Flour per cookie = 2 cups / 24 cookies = 1/12 cup/cookie. For 36 cookies, flour needed = 36 * (1/12) = 3 cups.

questions.q: The sum of two numbers is 25 and their difference is 5. What are the numbers?
questions.ex: Let the numbers be x and y. x+y=25, x-y=5. Adding the equations: 2x=30 => x=15. Then 15+y=25 => y=10. The numbers are 10 and 15.

questions.q: A car's price was reduced by 20% to $16,000. What was the original price?
questions.ex: If reduced by 20%, the current price is 80% of the original. Let original price be P. 0.80 * P = $16,000. P = $16,000 / 0.80 = $20,000.

questions.q: What is the next number in the sequence: 2, 5, 10, 17, 26, ...?
questions.ex: The differences between terms are 3, 5, 7, 9. The next difference will be 11. So, 26 + 11 = 37. (Alternatively, n² + 1: 1²+1=2, 2²+1=5, 3²+1=10, ... 6²+1=37).

questions.q: If a person can paint a house in 6 days, and another person can paint the same house in 3 days, how long will it take if they work together?
questions.ex: Person 1's rate = 1/6 house/day. Person 2's rate = 1/3 house/day. Together, rate = 1/6 + 1/3 = 1/6 + 2/6 = 3/6 = 1/2 house/day. Time = 1 / (1/2) = 2 days.

questions.q: A rectangular garden is 12 meters long and 5 meters wide. A fence is to be built around it. What is the length of the fence required?
questions.ex: The length of the fence is the perimeter of the rectangle. Perimeter = 2 * (length + width) = 2 * (12 + 5) = 2 * 17 = 34 meters.

questions.q: Three consecutive integers add up to 51. What is the smallest of these integers?
questions.ex: Let the integers be x, x+1, x+2. x + (x+1) + (x+2) = 51 => 3x + 3 = 51 => 3x = 48 => x = 16. The smallest is 16.

questions.q: A shopkeeper buys an item for $80 and sells it for $100. What is the percentage profit?
questions.ex: Profit = Selling Price - Cost Price = $100 - $80 = $20. Percentage Profit = (Profit / Cost Price) * 100 = ($20 / $80) * 100 = (1/4) * 100 = 25%.

questions.q: If Tom is twice as old as Jerry, and the sum of their ages is 36, how old is Tom?
questions.ex: Let Jerry's age be J. Tom's age is T = 2J. T + J = 36 => 2J + J = 36 => 3J = 36 => J = 12. Tom's age = 2 * 12 = 24 years.

questions.q: A bag contains 5 red, 3 blue, and 2 green marbles. If one marble is picked at random, what is the probability it is NOT blue?
questions.ex: Total marbles = 5+3+2 = 10. Number of non-blue marbles = 5 (red) + 2 (green) = 7. P(not blue) = 7/10.

questions.q: The area of a square is 49 cm². What is the length of its diagonal?
questions.ex: Area = side². So, side² = 49 => side = 7 cm. Diagonal d = side * √2 = 7√2 cm.

questions.q: A number is increased by 10% and then decreased by 10%. The final number is:
options: The same as the original number
questions.ex: Let the number be x. Increased by 10%: 1.1x. Decreased by 10%: 1.1x * 0.9 = 0.99x. This is 1% less than x.

questions.q: If x/3 = y/4 = z/5, and x+y+z = 60, what is the value of x?
A clock shows 3:00. What is the angle between the hour and minute hands?
questions.ex: At 3:00, the minute hand is at 12 and the hour hand is at 3. The angle between each number on a clock is 360°/12 = 30°. The hands are 3 numbers apart, so 3 * 30° = 90°.

questions.q: A farmer has some chickens and rabbits. There are 35 heads and 94 legs. How many chickens are there?
questions.ex: Let c be chickens (2 legs) and r be rabbits (4 legs). c+r=35. 2c+4r=94. From first, r=35-c. Substitute: 2c+4(35-c)=94 => 2c+140-4c=94 => -2c = -46 => c=23.

questions.q: What is the sum of the first 10 positive odd integers?
questions.ex: The first 10 positive odd integers are 1, 3, 5, ..., 19. The sum of the first n odd integers is n². So, 10² = 100.

questions.q: If today is Monday, what day of the week will it be 100 days from now?
questions.ex: 100 days = 14 weeks and 2 days (100 mod 7 = 2). So, it will be Monday + 2 days = Wednesday.

questions.q: A tank can be filled by pipe A in 4 hours and by pipe B in 6 hours. How long will it take to fill the tank if both pipes are open?
questions.ex: Rate of A = 1/4 tank/hr. Rate of B = 1/6 tank/hr. Combined rate = 1/4 + 1/6 = 3/12 + 2/12 = 5/12 tank/hr. Time = 1 / (5/12) = 12/5 = 2.4 hours.

questions.q: The average of three numbers is 15. If two of the numbers are 10 and 20, what is the third number?
questions.ex: Sum of three numbers = Average * 3 = 15 * 3 = 45. Sum of two numbers = 10 + 20 = 30. Third number = 45 - 30 = 15.

questions.q: A man walks 3 km East and then 4 km North. How far is he from his starting point?
questions.ex: This forms a right-angled triangle. By Pythagorean theorem, distance² = 3² + 4² = 9 + 16 = 25. Distance = √25 = 5 km.

questions.q: If 3^x = 81, what is x?
A pizza is cut into 8 equal slices. If John eats 3 slices, what fraction of the pizza is left?
questions.ex: Slices left = 8 - 3 = 5. Fraction left = 5/8.

questions.q: The product of two consecutive even integers is 48. What are the integers?
questions.ex: Let the integers be x and x+2. x(x+2) = 48. By inspection, 6 * 8 = 48. So the integers are 6 and 8.

questions.q: A bookshelf holds 25 books. If 40% of the books are fiction, how many non-fiction books are there?
questions.ex: Number of fiction books = 40% of 25 = 0.40 * 25 = 10. Number of non-fiction books = 25 - 10 = 15.

questions.q: If a = 2, b = 3, c = -1, what is the value of a² + bc - c²?
A meeting starts at 9:45 AM and ends at 11:20 AM. How long did the meeting last?
questions.ex: From 9:45 AM to 10:45 AM is 1 hour. From 10:45 AM to 11:20 AM is 35 minutes. Total = 1 hour 35 minutes.

questions.q: The ratio of boys to girls in a class is 3:2. If there are 18 boys, how many girls are there?
questions.ex: Let the ratio be 3x : 2x. 3x = 18 => x = 6. Number of girls = 2x = 2 * 6 = 12.

questions.q: What is 15% of 200?
